article.title: Applied Koopman Operator Theory for Power Systems Technology

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1(a) represents the New England 39-bus test system (NE system). What do the circled numbers in the figure represent?
choices: Bus numbers
Generation units (synchronous generators)
Load numbers
Transmission line numbers
Voltage variations of generators
Power flows in transmission lines
Time responses of rotor speed deviations
Frequency oscillations at different buses

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main purpose of using the Fourier-based formula (9) in Figure 2?
choices: To determine the voltage stability of the system
To identify coherent groups of generators based on swing dynamics
To calculate the power flow through specific transmission lines
To estimate the frequency of the infinite bus

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3(a) shows the empirical Ritz values (λj) obtained using the Arnoldi-type algorithm. What does the position of these values relative to the unit circle indicate?
choices: The voltage stability of the generators
The damping coefficient of each generator
The growth rate and stability of the corresponding Koopman modes
The power flow direction in the transmission lines

multiple_choice_question.text: What information do the amplitude coefficients (Aji) and initial phases (αji) in Figure 3(b) provide about the system\'s dynamics?
choices: The frequency and damping of oscillations at each bus
The voltage magnitude and phase angle at each generator
The spatial distribution and phase synchronization of oscillations for each Koopman mode
The active and reactive power generation at each generator

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 4 displays the distribution of amplitude coefficients (Aji) and initial phases (αji) for specific Koopman modes. What does clustering of points in this figure indicate?
choices: Generators belonging to the same coherent group
Generators experiencing voltage instability
Overloaded transmission lines
Buses with high reactive power demand

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the Jacobian matrix J(x[k]) in Equation (37) represent?
choices: The voltage stability margin of the system at time k
The rate of change of power flow in each transmission line
The action transfer operator that quantifies changes in action variables of the Koopman modes
The damping coefficient of each generator

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 8 shows snapshots of the action transfer operator J at different times during a coherent swing instability event. What does the increasing magnitude of elements in the upper triangular part of J indicate?
choices: Increased damping in the system
Stabilizing effects of voltage control devices
Growing energy transfer from high-frequency to low-frequency Koopman modes
Increasing power flow through specific transmission lines

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of data is analyzed using Koopman mode decomposition in Figure 10?
choices: Generator rotor speed deviations
Power exchange deviations between countries
Bus voltage magnitudes
Transmission line power flows

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the presence of a Koopman eigenvalue outside the unit circle (Fig. 10B) indicate about the system?
choices: Stable operation within acceptable limits
Presence of an unstable mode leading to potential instability
Synchronized and stable oscillations in the system
Efficient power flow with no congestion
